Hospitality is a legitimate part of business life and creates the chance to talk business in a social, less pressurised atmosphere. However it is possible that accepting hospitality can put people into situations which lay them open to accusations of bribery.  The more lavish the hospitality offered, the more likely it is to be regarded with suspicion and its purpose questioned.

A large part of the justification for hospitality is the building of a good relationship with the donor and the ability to discuss business in a social, less pressurised atmosphere.. An invitation to an event such as a sporting match or a meal is normally acceptable if the donor will be present.
If no-one from the company offering you these tickets will be present then it is assumed that it is for your own personal use and they should be declined.
